text: The Football Association of Iceland (Icelandic: Knattspyrnusamband Íslands; or the KSÍ) is the main association football body in Iceland. It was founded on 26 March 1947, and joined FIFA on the same year. It also joined UEFA in 1954. The Football Association of Iceland organizes and controls the Úrvalsdeild, Iceland national football team and Iceland women's national football team. Their headquarters are in Reykjavík. == Other websites == * Official website Category:1947 establishments in Europe Category:Football in Iceland Category:1940s establishments in Iceland Category:Organizations based in Iceland Ice
title: Football Association of Iceland
